cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, expected to bend northwest and slow, aiming for the middle Texas coast then stalling near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Matagorda

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island, TX (storm-surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Matagorda to High Island, TX (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely; low but increasing chance (13%) of sustained 50-kt winds by day 5.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible for San Luis Pass to High Island, including Texas City area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches possible with isolated 30 inches, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, and the potential for brief tornadoes in outer rainbands.
